news.title: Metals Hunter: 15% Global Flat Tariff Goes Live Today — Gold & Silver Surge as Stagflation Risk Premium Rebuilds
news.summary: The Trump administration invoked Section 122 of the Trade Act of 1974 to impose a 15% global flat tariff effective February 24, after the Supreme Court struck down prior emergency-power tariffs. Gold broke above $5,238 (LiteFinance) while silver climbed on stagflation and geopolitical risk premium, with structural demand expected to remain elevated even if Middle East tensions ease.

news.title: Crypto Sentiment: BTC Slips Below $65K on Tariff Risk; USDT Flashes a Rare 2022-Era Signal
news.summary: Bitcoin slipped below $65,000 during Asian trading as renewed tariff tensions weighed on risk appetite. Meanwhile, a USDT dominance signal — last seen in early 2022 before a major crypto correction — has re-emerged, suggesting capital rotation out of crypto into stablecoins. Analyst Timothy Peterson put an 88% probability on Bitcoin reaching $122K by late 2026 despite the near-term headwinds.

news.title: Polymarket/Kalshi: Kevin Warsh Confirmed as Fed Chair — Prediction Markets Move to Settlement
news.summary: Prediction markets confirm Kevin Warsh has been nominated as the next Fed Chair, replacing Powell. Kalshi's market showed odds surging from 31% to 81% on January 29 when Trump-Warsh meeting leaked, resolving near-certainty. The Polymarket Fed Chair market — nominally $510M — is now tracking settlement. Implications: a hawkish shadow cast on aggressive rate-cut bets for 2026.

macro.insight: Kevin Warsh confirmed as Fed Chair nominee — markets now reassessing the 92% March 50bps cut odds as Warsh is known as a hawk. The nomination introduces rate-cut uncertainty and is gold-bullish (dollar debasement narrative intact, but timeline shifts).

metals.insight: J.P. Morgan is the latest bank to raise its gold target to $6,300/oz by year-end 2026, citing 755+ tonne central bank demand floor and structural shift to hard assets. Deutsche Bank and Societe Generale have followed. The 15% tariff effective today adds a fresh supply-shock premium to both gold and silver.

crypto.insight: BTC down ~24% YTD and ETH down ~34% YTD — worst start in a decade (Fortune). USDT signal (rising stablecoin dominance) mirrors 2022 bear setup. However, analyst Timothy Peterson's Metcalfe-based model still shows 88% probability of BTC hitting $122K by late 2026, suggesting the current drawdown is a mid-cycle correction, not a trend reversal.

forecasts.note: Latest upgrade. Cites 755T central bank demand floor + tariff-driven dollar debasement.
Bull case of $7,200 on full geopolitical escalation scenario.
Strategic allocation shift from equities to hard assets driving demand.
Persistent central bank accumulation plus tariff-driven supply shock.
Forecast now below current spot of $5,238 — effectively a sell signal vs. peers.
Most bearish major bank — significantly below current spot. Deep contrarian view.

social_intelligence.insight: BTC sliding to ~$64,760 as Section 122 tariffs go live today, crushing risk appetite. USDT dominance signal mirrors 2022 — CT debating whether this is a capitulation flush or the start of a deeper leg down. Peterson's $122K model is keeping long-term bulls anchored.

ETH at $1,864 — down 34% YTD, worst start to a year in a decade. Crypto Twitter torn between 'accumulate here' and 'knife-catching' narratives. No clear catalyst to reverse ETF outflow trend in the near-term.

Today's 15% global tariff activation is THE dominant narrative on finance Twitter. Gold trading $5,238 is seen as confirming the 'debasement trade.' J.P. Morgan's $6,300 target being quoted everywhere. Stagflation fear is replacing soft-landing hope.

Silver charging toward $88+ with silver maximalists calling for $100 break. Supply deficit deepening — tariff disruption to industrial silver supply chains (solar, EVs) cited as explosive upside catalyst. Gold/silver ratio compression trade very active.
